Name: Browse Aloud
Description:
Browse Aloud

Make your website accessible with BrowseAloud's high quality speech.  New to South Africa, click here to read about the launch of BrowseAloud in South Africa. BrowseAloud adds speech and reading support tools to websites and online content to extend the reach of websites for the population that requires reading support. This includes those with dyslexia, learning or reading difficulties, mild visual impairments and those with English as a second language. This software program is designed to make online content more accessible to those with print disabilities and those who speak English or Afrikaans as a second language. Through the addition of a simple toolbar to your website, BrowseAloud gives reading support (including text-to-speech, magnification and translation) to your website visitors on any device – without requiring any payment or installation from the user. BrowseAloud is suitable for any corporate, government, educational or non-profit organisation seeking to make information available and accessible online to their customers, community-members, students or stake-holders.

Product Features

  •  Zero implementation and zero download
  • Compatibility with all major browsers and devices
  • High quality voices and international languages
  • Reads secure web pages and PDFs
  • Automatic updates
  • Free to the end user

Ultimate Typing

Learn to type like a pro using our easy-to-use, typing tutor software for schools.

Product Features

Name: Mini Beamer Transmitter
Description:
The Mini Beamer Transmitter is a rechargeable battery consisting of  a proximity sensor activation surface. This also includes an external switch jack. The Proximity sensor allows the surface to be activated by sensing motion 10 millimeters within the activation surface. This device is suitable for users with physical disabilities and is compatible with switches.

Features

  • Rechargeable battery included.
  • Proximity sensor included.
  • It requires the Mini Beamer, Original, or SLAT receiver.
  • Allows for one Mini Beamer transmitter to be paired with multiple receivers.
  • Activation surface senses motion within 10mm.
  • The Mini Beamer Transmitter is compatible with switches such as the Big Beamer Transmitter and Jelly Beamer Twist Transmitter
 

 Technical Specifications

  • The transmitter includes a 30 foot range
  • Includes external an switch jack

Description:
The Blue2 Bluetooth is a Bluetooth switch connecting to devices which provides a single or dual switch access to iDevices running Apple desktop, laptops and i0S7. The switch also runs accessible applications or software on these devices. Available on Tender RT275-2019 Tender Number: 85122108-00038

Features

  • Including a rechargeable battery.
  • Two external switch jacks.
  • Requires minimum pressure to activate.
  • Compatible with a tablet, laptop, desktop computer that have Bluetooth connection
  • Supports any software and application

  • It’s a Bluetooth switch device

Name: Rugged iPad Case
Description:
The Rugged iPad case is designed to provide secure protection for your iPad device for easy, portable movement at home, in the classroom or any environment.  

Features

  • The case is water and dust resistant.
  • Provides easy accessibility to all iPad ports and buttons.
  • Compatible with devices such as the iPad 2,3 and 4.
  • Easily adjustable mounting, compatible with various mounting systems.
  • Has a microlite switch for people with disabilities.
 

Technical Specifications

Name: Accounting Interactive Software Set
Description:
Accounting Interactive Software Set

This set of four Interactive Charts investigates key concepts in accounting, including Cash Flow Forecasting, Break-Even, the Trading, Profit & Loss Account and the Balance Sheet. The accompanying printable worksheets, additional notes, business activities and quizzes provide an informative, visual, and interactive introduction to accounting.

Name: Chords Interactive Software

Chords Interactive Software

This Interactive Chart investigates chords and how they are used to create triads. The user can click on the notes to hear the corresponding sound. The worksheet and quiz will help learners to gain further understanding of the topic.

Name: Switch4Apps for iPad
Description:
The Switch4Apps for iPad are Switch access switch adapted Apps and HelpKidzLearn Apps. The Apps are suitable for users who require simple switch access within applications and simple access to the media player.  

Features

  • Switch access to music.
  • User friendly with default settings support all switch adapted applications.
  • Quick media buttons to control music.
  • Timed play setting allows for music to play for 10-30 sec.
  • Includes a comprehensive range of programmable functions.
 

Technical Specifications

  • Compatible with iPad 1,  2 and new iPad
  • Compatible with iPad Touch 3rd and 4th generations
  • iPhone 3GS and 4
  • Bluetooth
  • 1-4 3.5 mm wired switches
  • Charges via USB

Name: Switch2Scan for iPad
Description:
The Switch2Scan for iPad Switch access switch adapted Apps and HelpKidzLearn Apps. The includes Switch access to iBooks and to the home screen. This is suitable for advanced switch users wanting to access to the main features of Apple devices and iBooks.  

Features

  • Highlight box feature scans the icons or items on the home screen.
  • Quick access mode enables the user switch access to switch adapted Apps once navigated to them.
 

Technical specifications

  • Compatible with iPad 1,  2 and new iPad
  • Compatible with iPad Touch 3rd and 4th generations
  • iPhone 3GS and 4

Name: Simply Works for iPad
Description:
The Simply Works for iPad is  a wireless switch access for switch adapted Apps and HelpKidzLearn Apps, music and home screen. This is suitable for users requiring wireless alternative access to Apple devices.  

Features

  • Highlight box feature scans the icons or items on the home screen.
  • It-Switch is a wireless switch.
  • It-Stick is a wireless joystick access.
  • It-Keys is a wireless keyboard access.
  • It-Send Pro and smooth talker supports up to six transmitters.
 

Technical Specifications

  • Compatible with iPad 1,  2 and new iPad
  • Compatible with iPad Touch 3rd and 4th generations
  • iPhone 3GS and 4
  • Bluetooth and Voiceover accessibility
  • Charges via USB

Name: Blue2 Bluetooth Switch
Description:
The Blue2 Bluetooth Switch is a dual switch providing Bluetooth wireless access. The switch is compatible with iPhone, iPad and iPod touch applications.

Feature

  • Synchronize the switch with compatible devices.
  • Switch scanning mode enables user to use the app hands free.
  • Blue2 supports both single and dual switch access.
 

Technical Specifications

  • Bluetooth dongle
  • Compatible with iPad, iPod Touch 3rd and 4th generations
  • iPhone 3GS and 4

Name: Hook iPad Switch Access
Description:
The Hook iPad Switch Access provides simple to vast control of your music playlist with an auditory menu of functions the user can control with the switch.

Features

  • iPod music library.
  • single or dual switch access.
 

Technical Specifications

  • Speaker output to headphones, portable speakers or home entertainment centre
  • Configurable volume limits for safety hearing
  • Includes charger or power from Apple device

Name: Roller 2 ( USB & PS2)
Description:
The Roller 2 is a trackball, which  incorporates a latching drag key. It is coded with 3 colours greeen, blue and yellow jack sockets for external switches, removable finger guard and USB/PS2 compatibility. Trackball is alternate to a mouse and offers an easy navigation for users of all ages. The device can be attached to to a desk or wheelchair tray.

Features

  •  no additional software required, allows you to plug and play.
  • Offers a high degree of control.
  • The  finger guard is removable.
  • Mounting Points.
  • Includes reversible Right/Left buttons.
  • Includes Latching Drag switch .
 

Technical Specifications

  • It features a 63.5mm trackball.
  • Compatible with PS2, USB, Windows and Mac.

Name: Roller Joystick 2 (USB & PS2)
Description:
The Roller Joystick 2 is a joystick designed specifically for educational and special needs. The joystick is user friendly with its rugged construction enabling easy usage. The Roller Joystick 2 is alternate to a mouse and require no additional driver software. This device is suitable for users with severe motor impairments.

Please note that this joystick has been discontinued by our supplier. As an alternative, please consider the n-Abler Joystick or the Optima Joystick.

Features

  • The Roller Joystick is supplied with additional interchangeable T-Bar and Foam Ball handles
  • The cursor movement is achieved by moving the joystick.
  • Includes colour buttons
  • Includes colour coded switch sockets
  • Removable finger guard
  • Mounting Points
  • No additional software required allows you to plug and play.
 

Technical Specifications

  • Compatible with PS2, USB, Windows and Mac

Name: Roller Plus 3 Trackball
Description:
The Roller Plus 3 Trackball is a trackball alternate to a mouse . The device is suitable for users who may have physical disabilities and find it challenging to use a conventional mouse. The device is user friendly and easy to set up.

Features

  • No additional software required.
  • Includes speed key control key.
  • Includes latching drag keyswitch.
  • Includes buttons that allow only up/down or left/right movement of the cursor.
  • Includes reversible Right/Left buttons.
  • Removable finger guard.
  • Mounting Points.

Technical Specifications

  • Large 63.5 mm diameter ball
  • Compatible with PS and USB

Name: OPTIMA Joystick
Description:
The OPTIMA Joystick is a joystick that is sensitive to the slightest touch. the device is alternate to a mouse and responds to accurate navigation and precise targeting of objects on the computer screen.

 Product Features

  • Includes 3 different handles.
  • Colour coded buttons mounted sub-flash to prevent accidental activation.
  • Allows for clicking buttons from remote switches.
  • Includes sockets to operate right/left.
  • Includes 4 cursor  and has an audible alert speed settings.
  • Provides a comfortable and natural hand rest.
  • Buttons includes left/right and drag lock.
  • Easy plug and play installation.

Technical Specifications

  • Compatible with PC and Mac
  • Includes 2 year manufactures warranty

Name: OPTIMA Rollerball
Description:
The OPTIMA Rollerball is a trackball alternate to a mouse. The device is suitable for user with limited hand control, motor skill difficulty, hand-eye coordination challenges including involuntary muscle spasms. The Rollerball is a silky smooth ball movement and large footprint for stability enabling the OPTIMA Rollerball ideal for a wide range of computer users.

Features

  • No Mechanical wearing parts.
  • cursor and tracking control.
  •  free running ball requiring a light touch.
  • A large footprint for stable operation.
  • Includes colour coded buttons mounted sub-flash to prevent accidental activation.

 Technical Specifications

  • Auto detecting USB and PS 2 Protocols
  • Compatible with PC and Mac

Name: Switchamajig Controller
Description:
The Switchamajig Controller is a programmable learning infra-red control unit. It is controled via a wireless network from an iPad by using the free Switchamajig Application. The controller layouts on the iPad can be used to control televisions, DVD players and CD players.

Features

  • User-friendly and easy to set up..
  • Infra-red remote allows for control with any device that has infra-red.
  • Includes a selection of ready-made layouts, can be easily edited and allows the user to create new ones from scratch.
  • Includes built-in library of commands to accommodate for many common devices.
  • Single and dual switch step scan.
  • Fully featured remote allows  the user to create as many panels as needed.
  • Set up panels with coloured buttons.
  • Add icons, pictures and auditory prompts.
  • Button size and layout can be customized to suit the user’s needs
 

Technical Specifications

  • Set up with PC or Mac to use WiFi network to link to your iPad

Name: Target and Touch Series:Patterns
Description:
Target and Touch: Patterns is a software program consisting of a range of activities with different styles of animated and music rewards. The software is suitable for users with visual difficulties such as Cerebral visual impairments.

Features

  • The bright contrasting colour and black background makes it ideal for users with visual difficulties.
  • Touch screen anywhere on the screen with a choice of patterns and colourful grids.
  • Touch It, Find and touch it encourages looking and targeting.
  • Peeping targets introduces a fun timing element.
  • Scattered targets need a series of presses before giving a reward.
  • Objects in a line helps to encourage left to right tracking.

Technical Specifications

  • Windows CD-Rom
  • 5 User copy
  • Site licence

Name: Target and Touch Series : Music
Description:
The Target and Touch: Music is a software program consisting of touch screen training activities with a cast of twenty musicians, from classical to fantasy, with a great music selection. The sotware program offers opportunities for language development and listening skills. This is suitable for users with visual and perceptual difficulties

Features

  • Touch screen anywhere to see who is playing this time.
  • Touch It, Find and touch it includes a wrapped up instrument- guess what it is before opening the bag to hear it play.
  • Silhouette of the musicians- guess who it is and open the curtains to see if you are right.
  • Peeping musicians-catch them to get a performance.
  • Scattere musicians need a series of presses before giving a reward.
  • Objects in a line helps to encourage left to right tracking.
  • Touch To Jump and Drag To Target- the musician will not play until they are under the spotlight.
 

Technical Specifications

  • Windows CD-Rom
  • 5 user copy
  • Site licence

Name: Touch Cats
Description:
The Touch Cats is a software programme for users to enhance their hand/eye coordination skills. The software allows the user for interactive experiences.  

Features

  • Playful, lifelike, interactive cats.
  • Independent play.
  • Touch, switches or mouse.
  • Five action packed scenes-house, alleyway and garden.
  • A journey of discovery.
  • Drag the cat and it walks with you.
  • Hit a switch and the cat explores on its own.
  • Language, storytelling, adventure, fun and enchantment.
 

Technical Specifications

  • Windows CD-Rom

Description:
The Touch Balloons is a software programme for users to enhance their hand/eye coordination skills. The software allows the user for interactive experiences.

Features

  • Use a switch mouse or alternative pointing device.
  • Alter  the colour, speed and number of balloons; choose bold or pastel colours to develop visual skills.

Name: ReacTickles2
Description:
The ReacTickles2  is a software program inspired by real world objects that children like to manipulate such as lava lamps, coins and spinning tops providing an accessible and engaging environment for imaginative play and learning.  ReacTickles2 can be used by young children with autism spectrum differences and learning difficulties to use with the computer.

Features

  • ReacTickles provides an engaging,  imaginative learning and play environment.
  • ReacTickles creativity box resources.
  • Ideal for young users to enhance their hand and eye coordination skills.
  • ReacTickles enhances the concerntration and attention skills.
  • Reactive colours encourages those with autistic spectrum differences and learning disabilities to use the computer and enhances them develop keyboard, mouse, programming and screen skills.
  • Fully switch enable.
  • Compatible with an interactive whiteboard, mouse, microphone and keyboard.

Name: Big Bang
Description:
The Big Bang is a software programme for users with severe and complex difficulties. This programme provides early experiential, cause and effect activities. The software is suitable for user in early stages of developing and awareness of cause and effect.

Features

  • Picture building.
  • Movements allow for eye tracking activities with full control over direction and speed of the reward.
  • Actions include 19 eye catching activities needing only a single switch press to give a great animated reward.
  • Colours allows the user to press the switch to change the colour of a screen full of bubbles.

Name: Big Bang Pictures
Description:
The Big Bang Pictures is a software program for users with severe and complex difficulties. The software is suitable for visually impaired users in early stage of development providing cause and effect activities. Big Bang Pictures includes an exciting choice of images and you can use your own choice of music. This tool is ideal for development with interaction among young users. The Big Bang Pictures software program can be used with switch devices.  

Features

  • Picture resource offers opportunities to develop off computer activities to supplement the on-screen.
  • 20 animated pictures available in 3 levels of complexity with choice of colour options.
  • Single or dual switch operation allowing users to select images.
  • Modes allows for 2 switch play and 2 switch choice modes.
  • Experiential, cause and effect, build.
  • Image selection includes a simple line art, silhouette or complex.
  • Own music selection.
  • Two colour choices, includes white, black and random colour combinations.
  • Configurable options allow you to meet individual needs.
  • Allows for switch and touch screen access
 

Technical Specifications

  • Windows CD-Rom
  • 5 user copy
  • Site licence

The Big Bang Patterns is a software program for users with severe and complex difficulties. The software is suitable for users in early stages of development providing cause and effect activities. Big Bang Patterns include exiting sound effects and music that can be used at an experiential level to promote looking and listening skills. This tool is ideal for development with early interaction among young users.

  • Touch and switch screen operation and experiential mode where the animation play automatically.

Name: ChooseIt! Maker 2
Description:
ChooseIt! Maker 2 is a software program that offers a simple to use framework for making personalized teaching and leisure activities by using simple step by step processes. The software requires for the user to press a switch to see a photo, picture and video clip with sound and text. ChooseIt! Maker 2 is suitable for education and learning assessment, quizzes, language comprehensions, sound lottos and offers a range of activities with no wrong answers.  

Features

  • Software allows for activities to be created in minutes.
  • Use your own photos, pictures, text or sounds or select from the library of over 1,500 files.
  • Includes a selection of PCS symbols.
  • Control the level of simplicity or complexity when creating an activity, allowing you to choose between 2-6 items.
  • Have 1 or more correct answers, spoken or written instructions and your choice of reward.
  • Includes an  introduction to simple switch scanning and auditory scanning.
  • Allows you to print out your activity.
  • Allows for sharing activities with others( even if they do not have ChooseIt! Maker 2).
 

Technical Specifications

  • Windsow CD-Rom
  • 5 user copy
  • Site licence

Name: Jumbo XL 2 Hi Visibility Keyboard
Description:
The Jumbo XL 2 Hi Visibility Keyboard is a Qwerty style keyboard consisting of all standard keys of a  keyboard  with the exception of the numeric keypad.  

Features

  • Large qwerty keyboard.
  • Has separate functions (f keys).
  • Windows key.
  • shift keys on both sides of the keyboard.
  • The keyboard is available in yellow keys with black letters.
 

Technical Specifications

  • Standard USB connectivity.
  • Dimension of 48.2cm x 17.9cm x 3.4cm.
  • X2 additional USB ports on the right hand side, ideal for attaching a numeric keypad, trackball, webcam etc.
  • Compatible with Mac (all keys have a Mac function) and Windows
  • Jumbo XL 2 Hi-Vis lowercase keys USB
  • Jumbo XL 2 Hi-Vis uppercase keys USB

Name: Keys-U-See Large Print Keyboards
Description:
The Keys-U-See Large Print Keyboards are high contrast alternatives to standard keyboards and have been designed specifically for those with conditions that cause visual impairment or low vision, such as: Macular Degeneration, Diabetic Retinopathy, Glaucoma, Cataracts and age related vision loss. The Keys-U-See consist of bigger and bolder typeface enabling users to see them easier.

 Features

  • Full-sized keyboard consisting of large print on key caps.
  • It is easy to see including in low light.
  • The keyboard is recommended for the visually impaired.
  • Hot keys such as internet, multimedia and energy-saver.

 Available Models

  • Ivory
  • White on Black
  • Black on Yellow

Technical Specifications

  • Compatible with Windows
  • Plug-n-play for Windows 7, NT, 2000, XP and Vista
  • USB keyboard connection

The Switch Skills further develop speaking, listening and concentration skills.  Switch Skills is suitable for users who need development in experimenting and progressing towards effective scanning skills, includes collaborative learning and playing between 1-2 learners.

Description:
The Slide Show Maker is a software program for development in making simple slideshows with accompanying music suitable for early switch users. The software can be used with a plasma, touch screen and mouse.

Name: SwitchIt! Jigsaw Maker 2
Description:
The SwitchIt! Jigsaw Maker 2 is a software program for personalised teaching and leisure activities which include easy ways of making your own photographs or other pictures into interactive on-screen jigsaws. This allows for pictures to be cut into two, four, or nine piece puzzles. It's and easy and safe way for the user to  Play on-screen and you’ll never have to worry about pieces being chewed up or scattered! Jigsaws can also be printed out for use away from the computer. SwitchIt! Jigsaw Maker 2 caters for switch users by connecting their device to a computer.

Features

  • Compatible with devices such as an interactive whiteboard, touch screen and a mouse and can be used with one or two switches.
  • Suitable for users who use switches to access the computer.
  • can be used with 1-2 switches.
  • Provides activities with finely graded progression in skill level.
  • Find the piece that fits the place chose by the computer and the requires the user to drag the pieces into their correct places.
  • The Jigsaw can be put together using the drag and drop methood.
  • Stimulation of building a real jigsaw.
  • SwitchIt! Jigsaw Maker 2 includes 4 levels of complexity to provide skill progression
 

Technical Specifications

  • Windows CD-Rom
  • 5 user copy
  • Site licence

Name: SwitchIt Facemaker
Description:
The SwitchIt Facemaker is a software program that allows you to decorate faces with all sorts of features. Children, parents, teachers or anyone can add their own photographs and dress it up with a variety of  hats, beards, glasses, earrings and more. SwitchIt Facemaker can also give people different eyes, noses, hair and funny ears, or even spots and face paint or even try dressing up a picture of your pet. The software is compatible with switches and consist of symbols for non readers.  

Features

  • Nearly 100 features give you access to thousands of combinations.
  • Allowing students to engage in creative exploration and experimentation.
  • Includes 4 play levels.
  • Supports users with severe learning difficulties for those in KS2 mainstream.
  • Includes full switch access and symbols for non-readers.
  • A cause and effect level adds features to a face in response to a simple switch input.
  • Completed faces are saved to a viewing gallery and can be printed out for further use.
  • SwitchIt Facemaker is ideal for cooperative play as well as PHSE topics, modelling (design and technology), art, supporting literacy and encouraging the use of mathematical language.
  • Other options allow all learners to be creative according to their own ability.
  • A set of printable resources is included for you to use away from the computer.
 

Technical Specifications

  • Windows CD-Rom
  • 5 user copy
  • Site licence

Name: Counting Songs 1
Description:
The Counting Songs 1 is a software program to assist young children with decision making processes. The Software program  includes a selection of songs, lively tunes and animated characters to choose from.

Features

  • A selection of songs include 10 popular songs, 7 which have been re-written to count up from 1-5.
  • Animated characters and lively tunes
  • Encourages children to count along with the music.
  • There are 3 progressive stages such as playing all the way through, counting before each verse and asking the child to count before each verse.
  • A set of accompanying activities consolidate and expand the children’s counting skills offered in 3 progressive stages includes simple counting of one character after another, counting characters along a number line and identifying sets of objects.
  • Compatible with devices such as touch screen, switches and a mouse.

Name: Matrix Maker Plus
Description:
The Matrix Maker Plus  is a software program that has been specifically designed to be the simplest and most affordable software for making communication overlays and education resources. With an easy to use intuitive interface, you can start creating and printing straight away with no need for training.  

Features

  • Includes over 11 000 Widgit Symbols.
  • Includes over 13 000 SymbolStrix Symbols.
  • Includes over 3000 IT Pictures.
  • Bank of ready made templates ranging from switch and communication device templates and worksheets.
  • You can add pictures from either the IT Media Library, the internet and your own pictures or take a picture with your webcam.
  • Once pictures are added, your template and will be ready for printing.
  • Add text
 

Technical Specifications

  • Windows CD-Rom 1-4 licences each
  • Windows CD-Rom 5-9  licences each
  • Windows CD-Rom 10-19 licences each
  • Windows CD-Rom 20-49 licences each
  • Windows CD-Rom 50  licences each
  • Windows CD Rom home user
 

Making symbol and picture resources is now as easy as 1, 2, 3

1. Choose your template

Matrix Maker Plus has a huge bank of ready-made templates. Over 100 commonly used communication devices and switch templates. A wide variety of low tech communication book templates to meet different needs. Add your own pictures to make motivational games and worksheets. Make personalised visual timetables, reward charts, stickers and certificates.

2. Add your pictures

Either from our IT media library with over 26,000 images, including the current and extensive SymbolStix and Widgit libraries. Search by key word, category or alphabetically using our intelligent search system. Or use our time saving Internet option - go straight to Google images, click on the thumbnail of your choice and the image is immediately added to your template. Or add a photo instantly using the webcam feature. You can also browse to any folder on your computer to use your own pictures. Add these to the IT media library for fast future searching.

 3. Print it out

Now simply print your communication board, worksheet, timetable or game. If you need to edit, there are simple intuitive tools to use. Drag and drop your pictures into the right place - pictures automatically swap and resize. Change the colour of cells and background. Alter size, colour and position of text. Tweak pictures and symbols with the simple paint tool.

The Boardmaker V6 is a software program suitable for users with language and learning difficulties. The software is used to create and print communication boards and educational material with picture communication symbols.

  • Includes communication symbols, pictures and graphics.

The Pragmatic Organisation Dynamic Display is a software program which provides practitioners with templates and guidelines to develop an appropriate communication book and also describes comprehensive strategies to enable the use of a system in a child's daily life, at home school and in the community.

  • Compatible with a whiteboards or  interactive plasma screen.

Name: IT Mouse Skills
Description:
The IT Mouse Skills is a software program which provides a range of carefully graduated activities for someone who is a beginner at using a mouse. The software program practices skills and many applications of the mouse.  

Features

  • Drag and drop by moving  the mouse over an object, drag and drop, drag along a path and practice using drop down menus.
  • Includes various clicking activities such as click timing, double clicking and clicking anywhere.
  • Introductions to each activity are provided and the successful completion of a task is met with a range of pleasing rewards.
  • Many activities within the software are configurable to meet the needs of the user.
  • Adjust the difficulty level and change the background for high contrast; ideal for low vision.
  • Customise the sound effects and colours.
  • Setups will be remembered when restarting the program.
  • Ideal to use with the Single Button Mouse.
 

Technical Specifications

  • Windows/Mac CD-Rom
  • Additional user licence

Name: Dolphin SuperNova Magnifier
Description:
The Dolphin SuperNova Magnifier is a software program for low vision and Braille users.  The software allows everything on the screen to be magnified instantly with one click. The Dolphin SuperNova Magnifier allows users to create or format documents, connect with colleagues and friends by using social networks or plan trips.

FEATURES

  • Dolphin SuperNova Magnifier software supports Braille displays.
  • Everything on the screen can be magnified by one instant click.
  • Magnify as much or as little as you need with Dolphin SuperNova Magnifier .
  • Zoom in for crystal clear detail or simple enlarge or enlarge as your sight changes.

Connect & View

With Connect & View from SuperNova, learners with low vision can connect to and magnify the teacher's interactive whiteboard on their own tablet or laptop. The student can then customise the view to meet their own magnification and colour scheme needs. The split screen feature enables them to make notes at the same time as monitoring what’s happening on the whiteboard.  This latest innovation enables learners with low vision to work effectively alongside their sighted peers in mainstream classrooms.  Learners can also take a snapshot of the screen to save it for later.

Connect & View with a Document Camera

Connect any high-definition (HD) camera to your computer and SuperNova Connect & View turns your tablet, laptop or desktop into a lightweight, portable video magnifier.  Magnify newspapers, magazines, bills, labels and even objects onto your computer screen.  Turn on Connect & View and the viewer displays what ever is under the camera lens.    

Technical Specifications

 
  • Magnifier Suite Windows CD-Rom
  • Magnifier Suite Pen Edition PC

Name: Bee-Bot Rechargeable
Description:
The Bee-Bot Rechargeable is a programmable floor robot. The Bee-Bot is child friendly and simple to use. This simple and child friendly layout is a great starting point for teaching control, directional language and programming to young children, suitable from Grade R upwards. Design your own mats or use the pre-designed Bee-Bot Mats to have your learners navigate the BeeBot through a fairytale land, a busy street, or even through numbers or letters of the alphabet. The BeeBot can be used to teach a range of skills and lessons, with students learning sequencing and spatial awareness incidentally.

Features

  • It’s a robust and small design.
  • With clear and bright buttons.
  • It’s memory consist of up to 40 steps.
  • No confusing degrees to program.
  • The sounds and flashing eyes are used confirm your instructions.
  • There are fantastic cross-curricular resources also available.
  • The device moves accurately in 15cm steps at a time and turns in 90°.
  • The dimensions are (L) 13cm (W) 10cm (H) 7cm.
  • Supplied with a USB lead and can be recharged through a computer or wall socket with a USB mains adapter (not Supplied).
Bee-Bot Rechargeable Docking Station A charging station for up to 6 Bee Bots.  This docking station is not only easy to carry around your setting, but is an excellent storage device for a class set of Bee-Bots, it can be wall mounted with six Bee-Bots in. Charge your Bee-Bot(s) within half a day for approximately 4 hours of normal use. Bee-Bot Rechargeable Starter pack Includes one rechargeable Bee-Bot, four activity mats (Treasure Island, Number Track, Transparent Grid and Long Transparent Grid Mat), sequence cards and ten white clip-on shells. Class Bundle Class Bundle includes:
  • 6 x Bee-Bots Rechargeable

Name: Talking Brix
Description:
Talking Brix is a 10s recording device. Use one Brix for personal reminders or attach as many as you like to create scalable and simple  communication grids. Talking Brix are light, portable and thin communicators with built-in magnets and can easily fit into your pocket. It can be place around your room or on a table. Talking Brix has a slot and tab connector to link to other Brix. Create multi- message communicators with Talking Brix Available on Tender RT275-2019 Tender Number: 85122108-00014

Features

  • Connectable devices for customizable layouts.
  • On each Brix there are easy single-message recording.
  • Recording time is 10 seconds.
  • Switch Power on/off.
  • Includes a free Snap Switch Cap.
  • Has built-in magnets.
  • Easily portable.
  • Talking Brix can be used for personal reminders.
 

Technical Specifications

  • Rechargeable battery (built-in)
  • Activation area: 1.8"
  • Each pack of 3 Talking Brix includes 1 each in Red, Blue, and Green.
  • Dimensions: 2.56" x 2.56" x 0.6" (L x W x H)
  • Activation Area: 1.8"

Name: Widgit Symbols for Clicker
Description:
The Widgit Symbols for Clicker is a symbol set which illustrates single concepts. The installer allows you to add Widgit Symbols to your Clicker activities to create highly effective learning support for communication and vocabulary development. This is suitable for users with special needs using early literacy or by a reader who has English as an additional language.  

Features

  • Consist of over 11 000 colourful, simply-drawn symbols.
  • Widgit Symbol sets are organised into clear and simple categories and sub-categories, for ease of reference and location.
  • Designed to support literacy.
  • A clear schematic structure which assists learners to develop their vocabulary independently.
  • Covers a variety of topics.
  • Includes a wide range of curriculum areas such as Maths and Science.
  • Add Widgit Symbols to Clicker activities by providing learners with a visual representation of all concepts illustrated by the words within text in the form of a ‘symbol language’.
  • This visual aid, along with the aural support provided by the synthesised speech feature, provides valuable reassurance to pupils for any words they are unsure of.
 

Technical Specifications

  •  Requires Clicker 6
  • Compatible with Windows or Mac PC
  • Single Computer License
  • 5 Computer License
  • 10 Computer License
  • 30 Computer License
  • Site License

Name: Mayer-Johnson PCS for Clicker
Description:
Mayer-Johnson PCS for Clicker is a symbol set that is widely used in the field of augmentative and alternative communication (AAC) and literacy support. The set consist of over 11 000 colour symbols designed to represent words and short phrases to support children and adults with communication challenges.  

Features

  • Clear and aesthetically pleasing to motivate learners as they use them.
  • Alternate symbols available for certain words, allowing the educator to tailor the set to a particular pupil.
  • The symbols can be used with Clicker software to support writing or to create a powerful communication aid.
  • The symbols can be used as a literacy support.
 

Technical Specifications

  • Requires Clicker 6
  • Compatible with Windows or Mac PC
  • Single Computer License
  • 5 Computer License
  • 10 Computer License
  • 30 Computer License

Name: SymbolStix for Clicker
Description:
SymbolStix is a software program originally designed and developed by News-2-You, Inc for use in its internet newspaper and online curriculum. The software programme depicts activities and people as vibrant, lively stick figures. Use SymbolStix with Clicker 6 to support writing or to create a powerful communication aid.  

Features

  • SymbolStix has been created with a distinctive flair to design "stick figures with an attitude".
  • Set consists of 11 000 symbols.
  • The software supports reading and writing for users with a variety of learning needs.
  • Each symbol describes a concept.
  • There are symbols for most commonly used words.
  • Symbols depict generic persons as stick people with no gender, age or culture.
  • There are specific attributes to ensure that learners pay attention to the concepts portrayed rather than being confused or distracted by details.
  • The set also includes a range of culturally-significant images such as politicians, popular fictional characters, actors, athletes and historical figures.
 

Technical Specifications

  • Requires Clicker 6
  • Compatible with Windows or Mac PC
  • Single Computer License
  • 5 Computer License
  • 10 Computer License
  • 30 Computer License

Name: Oxford Reading Tree for Clicker
Description:
Oxford Reading Tree  for Clicker is a software program which consists of a series of curriculum materials based on the popular Oxford Reading Tree book scheme. The series include 5 CDs each containing on-screen Oxford Reading Tree stories and associated Clicker activities.  

Features

  • Includes word, word practice, sentence, comprehension, writing and book making activities.
  • Activities vary between stories, allowing children access to a variety of tasks and for progression along the stages.
  • Develops literacy skills through carefully graded writing and reading activities.
  • The Oxford Reading Tree includes a wealth of resources available at your fingertips.
  • Promotes learning opportunities for the whole class and suitable for whiteboard teaching.
  • Offers support to struggling readers.
  • Allows children to work independently.
 

Technical Specifications

  • Requires Clicker 6
  • Compatible with Windows or Mac PC
  • Each CD ( Site Licence)
  • 5-CD ( Site Licence)

Name: Story Sequencer
Description:
The Story Sequencer is a recordable Bar to create stories and can be used as a multi-functional learning tool. Educators and learners are able to slot in 6 of their own words or images and then record a corresponding 10 second message per slot and then allows for play back. The Story Sequencer has many different activities and can be used as a tool to supports children with special needs.

Features

  • Can be used as a audio bar for users with special difficulties.
  • Audio function can assist users with visual impairments and recognition.
  • Suitable for users with Autism to use as a visual timetable or organise their day.
  • Create talking stories by placing images that correlate to parts of the story in each of the slots and record the section on each button.
  • Create phonics games by asking the learner to match the audio to the images.
  • Includes 6 black inserts.
  • Ideal for hanging on the wall.
  • Suitable for sequencing activities or story events

Technical Specifications.

  • Bar size: 11.5 x 56cm. Insert size: 7 x 8cm.
  • Comes with 6 blank inserts.
  • Recording time is 10 sec.

Name: Bee-Bot & Blue-Bot Transparent Grid mat
Description:
The Bee-Bot & Blue-Bot Transparent Grid mat is a clear 4 X 4 grid that can be used as a programming tool creating routes for the Bee-Bot. place the clear mat on top of an existing carpet, map or ask the pupil to design their own mats.

Features

  • Is a Long Transparent Grid Mat.
  • 2D items can be placed under the clear mat.
  • It’s ideal  to use with Bee-Bot card sets.
  • Place the cards out in a long line, the transparent grid with help protect and keep them in order Size 45 x 135 cm (Not picture.).
  • This clear 4 x 4 grid can be used to help with programming routes for the Bee-Bot.
  • Place the clear mat on top of existing carpets and maps or simply ask the pupils to design their own mats.

Technical Specifications

Size 60 x 60cm.

Name: Easi-Speak MP3 Recorder and Player
Description:
The Easi-Speak MP3 Recorder/Player is a player and recorder that allows the user to record their music, sounds or voices on the move. It is a wireless microphone designed for children to be talking, signing without being attached to a PC.  

Features

  • Record into the microphone.
  • Download your files straight to your PC through the attached USB player and playback your music, sounds and voice recordings.
  • Allows for recording time of 4 hours with high sound quality.
  • Allows for downloading of files consisting of WAV or MP3 format.
  • The Audacity Music Editing Software is provided as a file on the device.
  • Can be used in schools for many activities such as capturing audio during role play, investigate adventures outdoors, record audio for podcasts, encourages reluctant speakers and use to support children with EAL needs.
  • Record all school subject lessons such as maths, english, science, geography, music and even PE.
  • Ideal for oral assessment and APP.

Technical Specifications

  • Built-in Battery that is charged through a USB
  • Build-in memory consisting of 12MB
  • 4 hours recording time

Name: Talking-Point
Description:
The Talking-Point is a recording device that records and plays back 10 or 30 seconds of sound. It comes in all colours and can be used a teaching tool for colour coded question and answer games as well as taking messages.  

 Features

  • The device comes in 5 different colour recorders which allow for 10 seconds and the black device allows for 30 seconds recording time.
  • Loud and clear sound output.
  • Suitable for ages 3 years and older.
  • Ideal to build confidence in reluctant talkers.
  • Can be attached to a wall to create talking displays.
  • Can be used in fun school exercises such as treasure hunts, school tours, sequencing tasks, phonics and question & answer games with colour-coded answers a. Written question b. Question on Talking Point Pro.
  • Ideal for sending messages with children home or to other staff.

Technical Specifications

  • Includes replaceable LR44 batteries
  • 45mm diameter
  • Colour recorder: 10 sec.
  • Black recorders: 30 sec.

Name: Recordable Pegs
Description:
The Recordable Pegs are bright and colourful audio message recorders used on Nursery and Early Childhood development levels. The recordable Pegs are easy to operate – just a flick the switch to ‘record’, press the special light-touch contacts and allows for 10 seconds audio message recording time. To play the message back, flick the switch to ‘play’ and touch the contacts

Features

  • Comes in a set of 6 bright different colours.
  • Consist of a ‘non-slip’ magnetic back for display on the magnetic boards, surfaces or even filing cabinets. Creating all kinds of learning opportunities.
  • The loud playback is suitable for outdoors and indoors.
  • Ideal for little hands to manipulate.
  • Can be used in different learning activities such as for dens to record who lives there,what the purpose of the den is, who made it or as an electronic doorbell. Perhaps a dragon roar on a magical cave, or a mooing noise on the barn door?
  • Talking time lines or number lines.
  • Use with artwork describing what something is, who made it, or what the child was feeling like when they made it.
  • Creating a talking display by using pictures of parents carers with their voice.
  • Use for daily activities such as what children have done for the day at school.
  • To be placed near an activity so that children can follow instructions.
  • To be taken outside and use on fences, treasure hunts, clip around nature of an area for children to discover clues every time they press play.
  • Record interesting information in class.
  • Ideal for SEN Children as they are easy to operate with a simple touch switch.
  • Great for sequencing story parts or exploring language and communication.
 

Technical Specifications

  • Measurement: 10cm
  • Recording time of 10 sec.

Name: Big-Point
Description:
The Big-Point is a recording device that records for 30 seconds and plays back sound. The device is ideal for speaking,  listening and consist of a removable clear top that allows for creating pictures, numbers, letters and symbols to match your recording. The Big-Point is suitable for children with visual and motor skill impairments.  

Features

  • Ideal for children with visual and motor skill impairments.
  • Suitable for cross-curricular work.
  • Allows the user to record a part of a story, then add a word or picture underneath the clear lid, then ask the children to sequence them in the correct order.
  • Allows for recording sound effects and play back during storytelling.
  • Ideal for colour coded questions and answer games.

Technical Specifications

  • Available in 6 vibrant colours.
  • Batteries requires3 x AAA (not included)
  • Dimensions sizes:8.5 x 8.5 x 2.5cm.

Name: Rainbow Easi- Speaks
Description:
The Rainbow Easi-Speaks are fully rechargeable microphone MP3 recorders for recording sounds, music and voices on the move.It is a wireless microphone designed for children to be talking, signing without being attached to a PC.  

Features

  • Record into the microphone.
  • Assist with keeping track of children who are using each microphone, easing classroom management.
  • Download your files straight to your PC through the attached USB player and playback your music, sounds and voice recordings.
  • Allows for recording time of 4 hours with high sound quality.
  • Allows for downloading of files consisting of WAV or MP3 format.
  • The Audacity Music Editing Software is provided as a file on the recording devices.
  • Can be used in schools for many activities such as capturing audio during role play, investigate adventures outdoors, record audio for podcasts, encourages reluctant speakers and use to support children with EAL needs.
  • Record all school subject lessons such as maths, english, science, geography, music and even PE including observations and assessments.
  • Can easily be recharged through the docking station, eliminating wires to USB hubs and numerous PC’s.
  • Ideal for oral assessment and APP.
  • Conduct an interview.
  • Suitable for ages 3 years and older.
 

Technical Specification

  • 128MB of memory
  • Download via USB
  • Records directly to MP3 format
  • Up to 4 hours recording time
  • Complete with mains rechargeable docking station

Name: Sound Shuffle Sound Recording sequencing
Description:
The Sound Shuffle Sound Recording sequencing is a device for creating stories, sequencing and sound effects. The device allows for multiple recordings to be entered of up to 4 minutes each, and will play back in a random order for children to piece back together in the original pattern.  

Features

  • Recording time of 4 minutes.
  •  Sound Shuffle Sound Recording sequencing is ideal for PE activities such as 'jabberwocky' style stories, unpicking number sequences and puzzles.
  • Improves quality of individual learning experiences.
  • Designed to be safe and easily accessible.
  • Consists of two playback modes which are pseudo-random and sequential.
  • Suitable for individual work with one headphone socket.
  • Switch adaptable for SEN users.
 

Technical Specifications

  • Requires 3 x AAA batteries, not included.
  • Size 8.5 x 8.5 x 2.5 cm.
  • Wall mount available
  • Suitable for ages 3 yrs and older

Name: A5 Talking Photo Album
Description:
The A5 Talking Photo Album is a photo album which supports speaking and listening on the literacy framework. It focuses on photo presentations, sequences, hiding, revealing pictures and word recognition. Record your stories ,messages or timetables and simply insert drawings, pictures or photographs into the plastic wallets.  

Features

  • Allows for recording up to 10 sec message on each page to support the image or text placed in the plastic wallets.
  • Provides an excellent personal learning experience with the A5 size photo album.
  • Playback individual voices messages at any time by a simple push of a button.
  • Consist of 30 recordable buttons.
  • Consist of 15 double sided recordable pages (holds 6 x 4" photos).
  • Includes a pack of 1-30 reusable page number stickers.

Technical Specifications

  • The Talking album requires 2 x AAA batteries, not included

Name: A5 Rainbow Talking Photo Album
Description:
The A5 Rainbow Talking Photo Album is a talking photo album which combine communication  such as literacy and language development and ICT.

Features

  • Available in 6 beautiful rainbow colours and can be used alongside different themes.
  • Photo albums have 15 double sided pages to add personalised inserts, pictures or photographs and 30 recordable buttons to leave a 10 second message.
  • A great resource for recording learning journeys, creating talking story books, home-school link or for recording instructions.
  • The Rainbow Talking Photo Album offers hundreds of open ended speaking and listening possibilities.

Name: Rechargeable Stopwatches
Description:
Rechargeable Stopwatches is the world’s first rechargeable stopwatch. It includes a docking station- eliminating batteries and enabling a rechargeable stopwatch experience. The Rechargeable Stopwatches are ideal for school use and consist of functionality that primary teachers require and are easily and simple to use. Include stage and age appropriate settings.  

Features

  • Rechargeable, no need for batteries.
  • Available in a class set of 12.
  • Regarding unit included.
  • Battery life indicator on each stop watch.
  • Age appropriate settings available – Three stopwatches in one.
  • Show minutes/seconds, minutes/seconds/tenths, minutes/seconds/tenths/hundredths.
  • Settings can't be changed accidently - requires a paper clip inserting into top.
  • Cross curricular - Ideal for Science, Maths and PE.
 

Technical Specifications

  • Includes a docking station
  • 10 hours of usage before charging
  • Last for approximately 20 days when on standby.

The Easi-Detectors  are rechargeable  metal detectors in four colours. Easi-Detectors are designed for young users to develop communication and discussion skills and investigate materials. Suitable for role play in the classroom and treasure hunts outdoors.

The Easi-Torches are rechargeable torches that provide constant brightness for up to 3 hours and can be easily recharged in the hub once the battery is low. Easi-Torches are suitable for any primary classroom. It is ideal for exploring shadows and light without having to worry about having dim light and replacing batteries.  

Features

  • Battery life indicator.
  • 6 ultra bright LED torches.
  • Easi-Torch Connectors include 2 x yellow, 2 x blue, 2 x red, 2 x green.

Description:

Features

Name: Constructa-Bot
Description:
The Constructa-Bot is a floor robot using movement and controls, watch it transport, scoop and push resources from place to place. It is suitable for a pretend building site, board game or moving through different locations. Children can learn how to move objects around from one position to another using simple forwards, backwards right and left controls.  

Features

  • Built-in trailer for carrying items.
  • An ability to connect LEGO® pieces to the top to make unique designs
  • Enhance children's construction adventures.
  • Built-in dry wipe pen holder to trace Constucta-Bot's route
  • Use the pen holder to trace routes
  • Built-in trailer for carrying items
  • Programming includes
  • Create a sequence of up to 40 steps
  • Use any combination of Forward, Back, Left, Right and Pause commands
  • Forward and Back in 15cm (6") steps
  • Left and Right turns are 90°
  • Pause is 1 second
  • All commands recognised with friendly beep and flashing eyes
  • Press the green GO button to start or stop the sequence
 

Technical Specifications

  • Size: L22.5 x W12cm.
  • For ages 3yrs .
  • Requires 3 x AA batteries, (not included)

The Probotix software is a program which allows  for children to take complete control of their programming with this on-screen Logo programming software.   • Record button with 64 step memory.

Name: Easi-Ears - Digital Audio System
Description:
Easi-Ears - Digital Audio System is a Digital Audio System that includes a remote control unit, headphones and software to record, play and listen to MP3s.  

Features

  • Remote control unit is a fully featured MP3 recorder and player.
  • Can be transmitted to the headset as an alternative to syncing them on the docking station.
  • Record directly into the unit with built in microphone.
  • The MP3 line input also allows other devices such as a CD player to be linked directly with the unit and therefore headsets.
  • Teacher can control play, pause and track selection on the headsets.
  • Unique broadcast feature - teacher can interrupt listening and speak to all headsets.
  • MP3 recorder / player.
  • Transmit content to headsets.
  • The MP3 headphones are wireless and suitable for indoors and outdoors.
  • Contains buttons on the side of the headphones (play next/previous track, pause track).
  • The headphones are extremely robust; the headband can even be twisted without them breaking.
  • Adjustable to different head sizes.
  • Replaceable and comfortable ear cushions.
  • Automatic pause feature allows for the track to be automatically paused for approx. 20 min. if the headphones are removed enabling for the user to pick up from where they have left off
  • The headphones are recharged through the docking station supplied.
  • The headphones and remote control unit have the capacity to hold approx..2 hours MP3 recording time. This is a substantial amount and more than adequate for classroom use.
  • The software allows for removing or adding tracks. To upload content simple dock the headphones / remote control unit into the docking station and connect the docking station to your PC via USB.
  • Adding / deleting tracks feature allows you to navigate to MP3 files on your PC, through 'My Library'. From here tracks can be selected and dragged into the 'My Playlist' box to create individual playlists. Individual tracks or playlists can be added to individual headsets, or a simple 'Copy to headsets' button enables you to copy the same tracks to all six. Tracks are deleted by selecting then dragging to the dust bin or right clicking on the mouse.
  • Play a track.
  • Importing files - there are various tools within the software that enable you to import files. This could be bringing in MP3 files through the Library, importing files in a format that the software then automatically converts to MP3, recording sounds directly into the software (using a microphone) or ripping tracks from a CD, i.e. copying the contents off a CD into MP3 format that can then be brought into the software. This flexibility enables teachers to have a breadth of options in terms of the audio content they wish to add to the headphones.
  • Converts files - imported files such as WAV and WMA are automatically converted to MP3 (Easi-Ears preferred format); no need to use separate file converter software first.
  • Copy files from a CD - copy tracks from your favorite CDs into MP3 format for use on the headphones and remote control unit.
 

Technical Specifications

  • Headphones and remote control unit contain 256 MB of flash memory and store more than 2 hours of MP3 Recordings
  • Compatible with Windows XP, Vista or Windows 7
  • 100MB free disk space
  • At least 1GB memory
  • MP3 line input
  • Battery life approx. 20 hours
  • Site licence for Easi-Ears software included.

Name: Tuff-Cam 2 Digital Camera
Description:
The Tuff-Cam 2 is a Digital video camera and still camera in one.The rugged look design allows for a large screen and a trigger button to help avoid little fingers getting the shot. It Includes a Tuff-Scope 2 to take photos and videos of objects under the microscope. Suitable for children from as young as three.  

Features

  • Suitable for assessments.
  • Ideal for recording investigations and experiments indoors and outdoors.
  • The digital camera supports animation and podcasting activities.
  • It is robust and portable.
  • Allows for video taking and still images
  • Ideal for field trips.
  • Record children's role play.

Technical Specifications

  • Rechargeable no more batteries
  • Rugged design
  • Bigger 2.0" high quality TFT screen
  • Up to 12 mega-pixel (4032 x 3024)
  • Flat base to enable stop frame animation without a tripod
  • 32MB internal memory which can be expanded up to 2GB via SD card
  • Switch adaptable
  • AV socket for output to TV
  • Audio and video recording and playback
  • Can connect to any computer, just like a memory stick
  • Simple trigger for taking pictures and shooting video
  • XP, Vista, Windows 7 compatible

Name: Sequencing cards
Description:
The sequencing cards are cards that connect together and press the green play button on the first card to listen to all the cards connected in sequence. Sequencing cards are ideal for phonics, spelling, creating words and number work.  

Features

  • A fun way to practice word building.
  • Perfect for listening to how sounds blend together.
  • Ideal for practicing phoneme pronunciation, practice number sequences, sums or shape sequences.
  • Good for short stories or recounting events.
 

Technical Specifications

  • Size 75 x 75 mm per card.
  • Suitable for ages 3 years and older
  • Each card records up to 6 seconds- replaceable batteries

Name: Easi-Scope Microscope Device
Description:
Easi-Scope is a plug and play hand held microscope device that allows for attachment to your computer through a USB. The device consist of an LED light to help illuminate items that are viewed by simply holding the Easi-Scope over the object, focus by turning the top then take videos or still images. The device is ideal to use with a single control button at up to x 43 microscope magnification (using a 17" monitor).  

Features

  • Child friendly microscope.
  • Investigate materials.
  • Share with the whole class.
  • Suitable for ages 3 years and older.
 

Technical Specifications

  • White Balance: Auto
  • Interface: USB 2.0
  • Image Sensor: VGA CMOS Sensor
  • Image Resolution: 640 x 480 Pixels
  • Photo Capture: One-touch
  • Illumination: Built-in LED
  • Capture Image Resolution: 640 x 480 VGA (Interpolation up to 1200 x 1600 pixels.  Direct x 9.0 or above required for Windows OS, Interpolation up to 1280 x 960 pixels Mac OS)
  • Exposure: Auto
  • Luminosity: 3 Lux
  • Power: USB Cable connection to PC or Mac
  • Weight: 103g
  • Magnification: 35 times on 14 inch TV; 43 times on 17 inch TV; 53 times on 21 inch.
  • Software compatible OS:  Microsoft Windows 98SE, ME, 2000, XP, Vista, Mac OSX 10.4

Name: Easi-Scope 2  Wireless Microscope Device

Easi-Scope is a plug and play wireless microscope device which allows for recharging through  USB offering flexibility within your classroom and the outdoors. The device consist of an LED light to help illuminate items that are viewed by simply holding the Easi-Scope over the object, focus by turning the top then take videos or still images. The wireless device is ideal to use with a single control button at up to x 43 magnification (using a 17" monitor).  

Features

  • Rechargeable
  • Larger device which is easier to hold and investigate with little hands
  • Hidden antenna, aids ease of use
  • Create works of art from the detailed view of a leaf.

  • Consist of a 2 meter range.

  • Allows for recording from a MP3 player, CD player or computer.

Name: K’NEX Education Energy, Motion and Aeronautics
Description:
The K’NEX Education-STEM Building Solutions focuses on Energy, Motion and Aeronautics allows students to investigate a variety of concepts related to Newton’s Laws and aeronautics through problem-solving, discovery, exploratory learning and critical thinking. K'NEX® models offer hands-on learning opportunities encouraging scientific inquiry, investigation and experimentation. The K’NEX inquiry-based lessons challenge students as they build, investigate, problem solve, discuss, and evaluate scientific and design principles in action.  

Features

  • Applies to force and motion as well as the effects on idividuals who live and work in space
  • Activities and concepts are fashioned around rigorous content and National standards in Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics (STEM) Education.
  • The teacher’s guide follows a modified version of the 5E instructional mode- Engage, Explore, Explain, Elaborate and Evaluate.
  • Students will use the Scientific Inquiry and the Engineering Design Processes extensively throughout the lessons as they explore, create, invent, and innovate.
  • Lessons include worksheets, key terms, design briefs, design challenges, research and design logs, and rubrics.
  • Supports 6 - 9 students working in teams.
  • Grades 5 - 9.
  • Building instructions comprehensive teacher's guide aligned to Science, Technology, Engineering and Math Standards included.
 

Technical Specifications

  • Set includes 1430 K'NEX® parts – enough to build 9 K'NEX® Models, up to three at a time!
  • Packaged in a strong storage tub with snap-on lid.
  • The K’NEX Education-STEM Building Solutions focuses on Energy, Motion Aeronautics allows students to investigate a variety of concepts related to Newton’s Laws and aeronautics through problem-solving, discovery, exploratory learning and critical thinking. K'NEX® models offer hands-on learning opportunities encouraging scientific inquiry, investigation and experimentation. The K’NEX inquiry-based lessons challenge students as they build, investigate, problem solve, discuss, and evaluate scientific and design principles in action.

Name: K'nex Computer Control STEM Explorations
Description:
The K'NEX Education -STEM Explorations set is designed for students to investigate a variety of concepts related to science, technology, engineering and math. The modules are hands-on, cooperative activities providing stimulating inquiry and problem solving through design. With the software, Interface, various input/output devices, motors, and K'NEX Rods and Connectors, the students will experience problem solving in design and automation using programming, construction techniques, and devices to help them understand how to program and operate computer controlled devices.  

Features

  • Grades 5 - 9.
  • Building instructions and teacher's guide aligned to Science, Technology, Engineering and Math standards included. Packaged in a strong storage tub with snap-on lid.
  • The Teacher's Guide provides guidance to the teacher as they present a comprehensive STEM experience for their students with each and every lesson.
  • Students will be given specific problems, ask questions and conduct research using fair and consistent testing procedures, chart and analyse their data, refine solutions through feedback from their designs, and communicate their results.
 

Technical Specifications

  • The set comes complete with 820 K'NEX® parts, enough to build 9 computer controlled models, one at a time
  • K'NEX Interface and software (with site license), motors, push button switches, reed switches, a buzzer, and LEDs

Description:
Intro to Simple Machines: Wheels, Axles & Inclined planes set is designed to introduce students to the specific concepts associated with two types of Intro to Simple Machines: Wheels, Axles & Inclined planes. The models are hads-on, cooperative activities which all students to investigate, build and evaluate scientific principles in action.  

Features

  • Consist of a teacher guide that is used in conjunction with the k’NEX materials and individual Student Journals providing the information and resources needed to build students’ understanding of scientific concepts and channel their inquiries into active and meaningful learning experiences.
  • Supports 2 – 3 students working as a team
  • The set is suitable for learners in grades 3 -5.
  • Provides building instructions and comprehensive teacher's guide aligned to Science, Technology, Engineering and Math Standards included.

  • The set includes 221 K’NEX parts enough to build 7 fully-functioning replicas of real-world machines, one at a time.

Name: K’NEX Real Bridge building
Description:
The K’NEX Real Bridge building set is designed to assist students in their study of structural design, their function, history, geometrical dimensions and strength of bridges. The set involves investigating concepts that are related to the physical properties of materials and their application in design, placement and construction of bridges.  

 Features

  • Offers a variety of activities and background information provided to assist the teacher as they present the materials and answer student question.
  • Each lesson includes background information, Student Inquiry Sheets and objectives, Glossary of Key Terms, Journaling Opportunities, and Skill Builder Activities
  • Support 6 - 8 students working as a team
  • Suitable for grades 5 - 9. Building instructions comprehensive teacher's guide aligned to Science, Technology, Engineering and Math Standards included.
 

Technical Specifications

 
  • Set includes 2282 K'NEX® parts – enough to build 7, five to six foot long K'NEX® Bridge models, two at a time.
  • Packaged in two strong storage trays with snap-on lids.

Name: K’NEX Levers and Pulleys
Description:
The K’NEX Levers and Pulleys set are designed to introduce students to scientific concepts associated with two types of Simple Machines which are levers and pulleys. The set provides learners an opportunity to acquire skills using a hands-on, inquiry based approach to concepts and information. Students are encouraged to interact with each other as they investigate, build, discuss and evaluate scientific principle in action.  

Feature

  • Provides extension activities that can be used to explore the concepts more deeply are also included.
  • The Teacher's Guide provides the information and resources needed to build students' understanding of scientific concepts and channel their inquiries into active and meaningful learning experiences.
  •  Includes Teacher Guide on CD.
  • Supports 2 – 3 students working as a team. Grades 3 -5.
 

Technical Specifications

  • Packaged in a strong storage tray with snap-on lid.
  • The set includes 178 K'NEX® parts – enough to build 8 fully-functioning replicas of real-world machines, one at a time.

Name: K’NEX Forces, Energy and Motion
Description:
K’NEX Education Forces, Energy and Motion set  is designed for students to investigate a variety of concepts related to forces, energy and motion. The set provides students an opportunity to engage in the activities which allow them to learn, practice and apply integrated process skills. These concepts are fashioned around rigorous STEM tent and national standards in science, technology, engineering and math. Students will be expected to craft fair test procedures, create meaningful data displays, make reasonable and data supported reports, and analyse their collected data in light of the problem at hand. These are just some of the process skills that students must employ as they use the K'NEX® Education Forces, Energy, and Motion Set.  

Features

  • Supports 12- 16 students working in teams.
  • Grades 5 - 9. Building instructions and comprehensive teacher's guide aligned to Science, Technology, Engineering and Math Standards included.
 

Technical Specifications

  • Packaged in a strong storage tray with snap-on lid.
  • Set includes 442 K'NEX® parts, along with a Battery, Spring and Fly-wheel motor – enough to build 11 vehicles, up to four at a time.

Name: K’NEX Roller Coaster Physics
Description:
The K’NEX Roller Coaster Physics set isigned to assist students as they learn how to conduct and design scientific investigations, identify variable of the problem and select appropriate independent and dependant variable for investigations.  

Features

  • Determine the steps necessary to control a variable observe and record the response, and interpret the results
  • Allows for measuring, recording and analysing the data for patterns
  • Construct or scatter plots or histograms as a graphic representation of the data, and mathematically interpret those graphs
  • The Teacher's Guide offers ideas, in the form of nine lab exercises, which outline ways in which students in grades 11 and 12 may use the set to study physics, and in particular mechanics.
  •  The studies adopt a hands-on, student-inquiry based approach in which the teacher is encouraged to develop each lab investigation using the 5E model (Engage, Explore, Explain, Extend, and Evaluate) of inquiry while students utilize the Four Question Strategy for experiment design.
  • Supports 6 - 8 students working in teams. Grades 11 - 12.
 

Technical Specifications

  • Set includes 2039 K'NEX® parts – enough to build 11 roller coasters, inclined planes, and loop systems using K'NEX®!
  • Building instructions comprehensive teacher's guide aligned to Science, Technology, Engineering and Math Standards included.
  •  Packaged in 3 strong storage trays with snap-on lids.

Description:
The Discover Control set is designed for students with an excellent introduction to control systems and allows them to control a series of five models by pressing on the buttons on the Control Box. The software allows students to write computer programs in easy to understand steps using a model and electronic devices that respond to every press of the buttons.

  • The teacher guide and lessons that will assist you guide and facilitate student learning.
  • The activities provide opportunities for students to learn aspects of linear computer programming while investigating, discovering and applying STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics) skills and knowledge.
  • Suitable for grades 1 - 3. Building instructions and teacher's guide aligned to Science, Technology, Engineering and Math standards included.
  • Using K'NEX parts, the K'NEX Control Box and Discover Control Software with the direction provided in the guide, you will be able to offer students a program of study that uses hands-on exploration in conjunction with an engaging inquiry-based approach to learning as students build, program, investigate, and evaluate ideas.

Name: Focus on Key Stage 1 DT Design and Create
Description:
Focus on Key Stage 1 DT Design and Create is an educational software program that supports the teaching of 7 popular KS1 Design Technology themes. Name: Widgit Health First Aid Communication Book
Description:
The Widgit Health First Aid Communication Book is a software program designed to help those carrying out first aid to ask questions and understand responses from people for whom communication is difficult. The software program is an effective communication too in assisting people that have learning difficulties, people who do not speak English and people who cannot speak or hear due to thier current condition.  

Features

  • The Symbols add meaning to any questions or statements to the patient and effective response by the patient answering by pointing to symbols.
  • The first aider can point to the symbols to add meaning to any questions or statements to the patient. The patient can answer by pointing to symbols.
  • The layout of the booklet mirrors the progression of medical situations from the first contact through to diagnosis and initial treatment.
  • The back of the booklet provides easy access to a pain scale and core responses that may be used at any time. For example, the responses ‘Yes’ and ‘No’.
  • Widgit Symbols can be used as a communication tool with assisting dialogue with users with learning disabilities.
  • suitable for people who do not speak English also including people who cannot speak or hear due to their current condition.

Name: Widgit Health First Response Communication
Description:
The Widgit Health First Response Communication is a software program to assist respondents to ask and understand medical questions and responses from people who find it difficult to communicate.  

Features

  • he Symbols add meaning to any questions or statements to the patient and effective response by the patient answering by pointing to symbols.
  • The first aider can point to the symbols to add meaning to any questions or statements to the patient. The patient can answer by pointing to symbols.
  • The layout of the booklet mirrors the progression of medical situations from the first contact through to diagnosis and initial treatment.
  • The back of the booklet provides easy access to a pain scale and core responses that may be used at any time. For example, the responses ‘Yes’ and ‘No’.
  • Widgit Symbols can be used as a communication tool with assisting dialogue with users with learning disabilities.
  • Ideal for Doctors, Nurses, Paramedics, Ambulance Crews, Clinicians, Community first responders, Fireman and Policeman
  • It can also be a valuable tool for anyone talking about a potential medical situation before it arises.

Name: Five Finger Typists
Description:
The Five Finger Typist is a typing software program that develops keyboard skills. The program is suitable for children who uses a physical keyboard or an on screen version. The software further enhances their typing skills if they know their way around the keys.  

Features

  • Include a complete set of typing lessons for both right and left hands.
  • It teaches keyboarding techniques for single handed touch and typing on the QWERTY keyboard.
  • Allows for users to learn the home position, and completes the exercises that introduce new keys and revise keys already learnt.
  • The application remembers the last lesson worked on and allows the user to pick up from where they have left off.
  • Lessons are graded for assessments.
  • Key guidelines with animated hand graphics on the screen which shows the correct hand movement as the user types.

Technical Specifications

  • Compatible with Windows/Mac CD-Rom

Name: Widgit Patient Communication Sheet
Description:
The Widgit Patient Communication Sheet is a software programme or sheet  for patients who struggle to communicate in hospital. The Communication sheets are suitable for users who already have existing communication difficulty to those who have developed one as a result of illness and treatment.  

Features

  • The sheet is designed with symbols so that patients of all languages and reading abilities can communicate with pictures and symbols without speaking.
  • Consist of all popular requests and replies.
  • Includes a pain scale and body diagram .
  • Copies are available printed on waterproof and tear proof sheets.
  • There is a bespoke design service that is available to provide the patient with alternative options and designs should the Patient Communication Sheet not be applicable.

Name: Widgit ICE Communication Cards
Description:
The Widgit ICE Communication Cards are communication cards that contain details of the people you wish to be contacted in the case of an emergency. They contain all important information about your health and medical requirements. In the case of emergency all medical professionals are trained to look out for an ICE card in any situation where this is required.  

Features

  • The ICE Card is a size of a credit card which is easily folds out to a larger sheet.
  • The one side illustrates a symbol and the reverse side contains all your ICE information.
  • The information sheet provides an easy access to a pain scale and core responses that may be used at any time and includes responses Yes and No.
  • It is highly recommended that every person carries an Ice card, it is effective and saves lifes in an emergency.
  • The symbol communication sheet provides a quick visual tool that can be used by anyone to clarify and understanding.
  • Ideal for situations such as an accident, traveling, users with disabilities such as Down Syndrome, Dyslexia and Autism, elderly people and people who have suffered a stroke.

Name: Widgit Health Communication support for healthcare
Description:
The Widgit Health Communication support for health provides the ability to communicate quickly in a health emergency. This will save lives and assist treatment. This is suitable for all health professionals to assist with ensuring that the correct support is available in the case of emergencies.  

Features

  • Widgit Health and healthcare professionals have collaborated to assist in creating products to support and meet the needs of modern health services.
  • In the event of an emergency everyone should save guard themselves by implementing basic steps such as carrying and ICE Communication card. It’s a cost effective and easy way to prepare for the unexpected.
  • Suitable for users with communication difficulties to assist diagnose their pain and illness. This can also be used for understanding the treatment process to minimise the distress people can face in these situations.
  • This is an effective way to determine whether organisations are meeting their obligations.
  • The Widgit pack includes medical flash cards, a glossary and 342 Widgit Symbols that is specifically designed for use in health care settings

Name: Widgit Online
Description:
The Widgit Online is a software program which allows you to create, save and share symbol-supported documents in the cloud.

Features

  • Allows for storing and managing your documents online.
  • Allow the user to login from anywhere with an internet connection.
  • Allows for creating new documents with the same features as the Widgit SymWriter 2.
  • Can be used as a speech support tool.
  • Allows for downloading and uploading documents to work with SymWriter 2 on your PC.
  • Allows for sharing with users in a group account.
  • Make documents public to share with anyone.

Technical Specifications

  • Single user allows for 1 account
  • Medium school allows for 400 accounts
  • There are alternative accounts such as small-large school, family and a small-large organisation
